title: Is there ever loss forgiven when there is proven electricity/internet outages?
body:
For example, last night I was in my second promotion game and the power went out. It turns out over 5,000 customers in my area lost their electricity for about 8 hours. I have not gotten a chance to go back and see if we won or lost (and even if we didn't I think I still get a loss for disconnecting), but I'm assuming we did and I feel really bad that I ruined the experience for others as well as earning myself a promo loss. 

My question is: Do we ever get loss forgiven for disconnections out of our control? I could send a news article and/or direct you to the power company's website for proof that there was a large blackout which prevented me from finishing the game. I'm sure it is a long shot, but just curious if there is a precedent for this type of thing. 

Thanks!

replies.body: DTN's information is solid.  Loss Forgiven activates for the region when it impacts a high amount of players at once.  It's not something that can be turned on retroactively or individually.  We have a[ Loss Prevented](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201753014-Loss-Prevented) guide available with additional information.  I hope that helps!
I didn't realize there was a 'Loss Prevented' article. Thank you for all your work here on the H&S board :3
No, Riot only turns on loss prevention when there is a widespread issue on their end. They will not go in and retroactively remove losses for players.

I didn't think so, but wanted to make sure. Thanks for letting me know! 

It's okay, though. I was worried I would come back with a longer queue for the Leave, but I didn't. I got into my game right away and won the third promo match to get to Bronze III finally lol

There could be a variety of reasons for why Loss Prevention can activate, but widespread server issues on our side is certainly a possible bet and what I've seen from my own experience.  I hope that helps clear things up, and I sincerely wish you all the best in your next ranked matches!

My internet just went out about an hour ago, was down for the entire game and i come back to get an afk lower priority punishment. Beyond my control but now i have to wait 20 minutes before i can even attempt to get in a game for 5 games in a row 1 hour of just waiting when it takes 10-15 minutes to just get a game started... Totally fair and just... Oh and Riot will not reduce punishments under any circumstances or so I'm told if any Riot employees see this and know otherwise feel free to comment.
